Action footer
The action footer for Prompt is available in single or double action, stacked or side by
side. The side-by-side variant is dedicated to large-screen displays where we have more
space for the copy to fit. On small screens, we stack the actions instead as the space is
often limited. The Button size variant also changes at the breakpoint from small (S)
screens to medium (M) screens.
You can also adjust which Button comes first, primary or secondary, depending on
your use case*. Though we would advise keeping the alignment consistent - horizontal
alignment has the primary Button at the end, whereas vertical alignment has the
primary Button at the bottom (unless it is a "cancel" action).
*Does not apply to mobile native variants of the component. The order of the buttons is
fixed and follows common native mobile usage patterns.

Backdrop
The backdrop is not part of the component in Figma. Examples and instructions on how
to make the backdrop are provided on Skapa Components Modal Figma page. Please
note that there are visual differences between platforms on how dark and opaque the
'dim' appears.
Behaviours
Modals are fragile compared to a regular page as their temporary nature makes them
easy to dismiss. For this reason, no modal should ever contain complex or high-stakes
tasks that could risk users’ information being easily dismissed and lost.
More on modal content and behaviours.
Dismissing and completing
Prompts are primarily dismissed by choosing from the actions provided. However, they
also have a close button and are dismissible by tapping the backdrop or pressing Esc
key, allowing a cancellation without choosing. The closing X button functions as a
reassurance - when you use it, you know you are closing the Modal only. You're not
making a choice which will lead to further developments. It can be redundant as one of
the action buttons will, in most cases, perform the same action. Including a closing
button ensures the Prompt is accessible and provides an alternative way out. That
creates reassurance that you can take a step back if needed.
